comments.comment: Waht is this donkey saying? Sexual education needs to be given formally. Then he will suggest that students should be given a practical session in school. Is he aware what kind of culture prevailing in Sri Lanka? Has his brain been washed by the western elements. Every family knows that children get a knowledge about changes in their body when they grow up and there is no need to publish all those stuff in a separate book. Who demanded that they need a book? Was there a real need to publish such a book? Did this bastard conduct any study to find out if students are in need of such a book? Just wasting his words over something that is useless and worthless.  Students learn many things informally and sexual education is the same. Sri Lankan culture is still eastern not western. This kind of people are real destroyers of Sri Lankan culture, values and tradition.
comments.author: gavi 876
